title: Can we make a 10 game rule?
body: A rule where you have to play a champion for 10 games in a normal que before you can play them in ranked?

replies.body: That is a lot of busywork man.  If you know how to Corki, it doesn't take 10 games to learn to Graves.
Thats why {{champion:20}} in his stats has high dificulty
I think it's a good idea, but what if the one champion the person played 10 games with got banned? Just cancel out the match?
I would actually assume they would change the "16 owned championed required for rank" to "16 owned champions who you have played 10 games with"
That would be dumb. 160 games is a terrible lot of games, sure for first time accounts it could be needed, but for smurfs it would be painful

A) We probably shouldn't be tailoring to the smurfs, since they make things so bad for new players.

B) 160 games is probably less than you'll play from 1-30.
Its actually more for the average player. It takes about 120-150 games to hit lvl 30.

Really? I thought it was somewhere around 300 on average. Someone further down the thread posted that you reach 30 in 365 games, assuming average 110 EXP per game. (No firstwin bonus for XP, so that's pretty reasonable, if not high.)

That is a REALLY high number. Those must be flooded with bot games. I played a lot of PVP when i started and I went from 1-30 in about a month so assuming I had 30 1st win bonuses. I was out of work at the time and was able to just play. I remember tracking it at about 130 games personally. Now maybe they have tweeked the numbers since I started almost 2 years ago, but thats how much it took me with no boosts. I'll say it again. Those have to include a lot of bot games or they must have just only lost.

It would be bad, but it's the only way to make this system work. Therefore, I think this system would need to be altered. IMO 3 games is more than enough to learn a champion. That brings it down to much more manageable 48 games. And to be honest, I really don't think we should be making concessions for smurfs, as they aren't fair in ranked anyway.

> [{quoted}](name=The Ellimiist,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ILncFqy1,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2015-01-10T05:01:50.657+0000)
>
> I would actually assume they would change the "16 owned championed required for rank" to "16 owned champions who you have played 10 games with"

The problem is if you are last pick and say need a jungler, with only 2 jungle champions that you have 10x games with, and one is banned and the other team picks your other choice (or both or banned). Then you are forced into suboptimal picks (i.e. having to pick a nontraditional jungler from your roster of available champions) or leave,with the associated LP loss due to dodging.
That same problem already exists if you only own 16 champs (the requirement for ranked). Changing it to 16 champs with 10 wins would be no different.

The difference is tho now you don't need to play 10 games on them so you are freed up a bit. It would constrict you more with having to play those 10 games in that case. At least now I can eve jungle even if I've never eve jungled. I can still fill the role my team needs if I have the champ since I'm probably going to bomb if I'm going eve jungle or Vlad jungle. It doesn't matter if you can't play them if they are not going to excel in the role given.

I think that more falls under communication than the main idea of this thread. For example I have had people say "I only own adc champs" and at that point its up to your team to let them adc or expect them to fill another role poorly.

Thats the general concept I was trying to convey, but never directly said. Assuming the Idea passes, just because someone plays 10 games with a champ doesn't mean they will be able to play them in other roles. 

I've heard exactly what you were talking about from people before and it makes me a bit ticked. I get being good with one role, but you should always have at least the 450 champs to play for every role. Forcing this 10 game rule to play a champ won't change this mindset and will actually give them a bit more validation to  playing this way as well since they "haven't played enough games with other roles."

The main idea is to not have that guy who is missing every skillshot, blows his ult the first 3 times etc cuz he literally doesn't have enough experience even using the champions abilities. Maybe 10 games is too many and even 5 would be enough but its still a good idea imho.

"Assuming an average XP gain to be about 110 XP per game, one can reach summoner level 30 within 365"

http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Experience_%28summoner%29

It takes  300 games of pretty much straight winning on an account to level it up. If you can't play 20 champions 10 times each by time you reach 30, then you don't need to play ranked...

Honestly if a system like this existed I personally feel like we should get rid of lvls since they would essentially be rather pointless obstacles. If it takes more games to get 16 champs to 10 games each then it does to reach lvl 30 it seems as though it would make sense to just drop lvls and find a new system to work with.
the only reason that would be left to keep them is when you can access runes i guess, but that needs to be reworked anyway so i would agree.

I don't think you should be gated though with runes. I think its a very stupid way of doing things and doesn't help anyone when you are trying to experiment with them. Runes aren't something that is inherant to a new player. They don't really understand why you go Armor seals over health or which quints to pick. To me they need to completely revamp the runes anyway and let you have them all since most people don't really build towards rune pages until they are at least lvl 20 so unlocking them one at a time is just rather pointless.

Just because youve played them 10 times doesnt mean that youll be good with them.  i suck at lee and diana but ive still got 10+ games on them.

the third time i played teemo was in ranked, and i used him to demolish darius.  
Banning would become easier yes, but counter picking would as well.
That limits someone to 1000+ games in order to play every champion in ranked.
